Text:
Back in DC to recap our trip overseas.
¬†
Our delegation was clear: we remain fully committed to unity w/ our European allies. We must address threats to democracy around the world, promote the role of diplomacy, & invest in equitable resources in the global fight against COVID. https://t.co/Vsas0zhaTp

However, given recent Russian escalation,¬†it is important to stress that any new military deployments¬†must be done in full compliance with Congress‚Äô constitutional war powers and the provisions of the War Powers Resolution.
I am confident in President Biden‚Äôs repeated commitment to keep U.S. military personnel out of any conflict in Ukraine¬†itself.
If Putin continues to choose aggression over diplomacy, then we must also be prepared to help lead a humanitarian effort to support Ukrainians fleeing the conflict.

While we work in coordination with our European allies to respond and impose targeted sanctions, we must continue to do all we can to de-escalate and utilize the full power of diplomacy to find a negotiated solution to this crisis.

I strongly condemn Russia‚Äôs escalation of actions to destabilize Ukraine and further undermine its territorial sovereignty and call for the immediate retreat of all Russian military personnel from Ukraine, including Luhansk and Donetsk. 

(üßµ1/5)

Guilty is right. My prayers are with Mr. Arbery‚Äôs family at this time. This will never bring him back, but this is another step toward true justice and accountability.
https://t.co/HYvhBPrp2i
Sending my condolences to Paul‚Äôs family and loved ones. May he rest in peace. üôèüèæ

I had the privilege of working with Paul on many issues, from improving social inequities in global health, to ending HIV/AIDS, to helping the people of Haiti determine their own future. He was an amazing man whose legacy will live on through his work.

I am deeply saddened by the loss of Dr. Paul Farmer, a public health icon whose vision & impact changed countless lives across Haiti, West Africa, and the world. A caring, loving human being whose work wasn‚Äôt just a job, but a mission. https://t.co/2o64jfpMiF
Great to be here in London! Looking forward to working with our British counterparts to promote mutual security & prosperity.üá¨üáß https://t.co/eq3QFgSXqf

Our delegation held discussions with key leaders to discuss our commitment to diplomacy, including a briefing with @SecBlinken and meetings with German Chancellor @OlafScholz, @NATO Secretary General @jensstoltenberg & @EU_Commission President @vonderleyen. https://t.co/fgOti5qynY
This is one of the most crucial moments in modern history to show our unwavering commitment to @NATO and the transatlantic partnership.

It was an honor to join so many distinguished world leaders at the 2022 Munich Security Conference to reaffirm the US commitment to peace, security, & mutual prosperity, especially in light of the growing threats to regional stability and democracy across the globe. #MSC2022 https://t.co/cEhcx7AZJ6

One year of leadership from @POTUS means real change #ForThePeople.

From fighting back against COVID to restoring our reputation abroad, we‚Äôve accomplished so much.

Happy #PresidentsDay! https://t.co/tXDMmFUdhm

Every day that passes without major action on climate, the world grows dangerously closer to irreversible tipping points. 

We cannot afford to wait.
https://t.co/w6To2ufa6w

With @ClimateEnvoy & @BettyMcCollum04 at the Munich Security Conference!

Climate change must be part of any discussions regarding our national and global security. #MSC2022 https://t.co/9kTInEOOW3

80 years ago, Executive Order 9066 mandated the imprisonment of 120,000 innocent Japanese Americans across concentration camps in the Western United States.

Today, we remember their stories and sacrifices and recommit to fighting racial prejudice, bigotry, and abuses of power.

The US has been a leader in the global fight against COVID. We‚Äôll never eradicate this pandemic without continued meaningful investment in global vaccine distribution & equity. I will keep fighting to meet the public health needs of our global community.
https://t.co/b5C5F40Art

Great to be here at the Munich Security Conference with my colleagues, @VP & other world leaders to reaffirm our commitment to the transatlantic partnership & achieving global peace and security. üá©üá™ ü§ù üá∫üá∏ #MSC2022 https://t.co/E3z7f94FUe

Congressional action has never been more critical. Thank you @SenSchumer. https://t.co/tV6RQjONvZ

Being a member of Congress is about serving the public‚Äôs best interests, not your own‚Äîabusing this position for financial gain should be illegal.

Ban members of Congress from owning individual stocks.

The cost of child care has risen 214% since 1990‚Äî2x as fast as food & housing‚Äîand yet caregivers still make just $12/hour.
 
Families shouldn‚Äôt go broke paying for child care, & the people caring for our kids shouldn‚Äôt live below the poverty line.

How is this controversial?

California‚Äîthe world‚Äôs fifth-largest economy‚Äîis leading the way on emissions reduction & climate action.

Proud of our state. Time for the federal government to follow. https://t.co/IXvMI5Yiav

In 2017, 81% of cannabis business owners in the US were white.
 
Meanwhile, 40,000 people‚Äîmostly people of color‚Äîare serving time for marijuana related offenses.
 
If this isn‚Äôt injustice, I don‚Äôt know what is.

Thank you for the #BlackHistoryMonth recognition, @MarijuanaPolicy!

The racist, classist war on drugs must end.
https://t.co/LnAAKOUzeU

"If the First Amendment means anything, it means that a state has no business telling a man, sitting alone in his house, what books he may read or what films he may watch."‚ÄîThurgood Marshall https://t.co/gCRYBHYgWB

The longer it takes to vaccinate the world, the more variants we will see‚Äîand the longer this pandemic will go on.

The US must do more to ensure equitable access to vaccines, testing & treatment worldwide.

‚ÄúIf there is no struggle, there is no progress.‚Äù
 
Today we celebrate the chosen birthday of Frederick Douglass, abolitionist leader & American hero. It was common for those born into slavery to not know their exact birthday‚Äîso Douglass chose his own. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/iQ0jQUw42I

Four years ago today, we lost these 17 lives in just 6 minutes during one of the deadliest school shootings in US history.

Thousands more have been lost to gun violence in communities across the US since. These deaths are preventable. Congress must act. #NeverAgain #MSDStrong https://t.co/b9OGGocac0

The reserves of the Afghan central bank belong to the people of Afghanistan who desperately need it to try to stabilize their economy and country. 

Taking these assets from the Afghan people for the actions of the Taliban is not a solution. https://t.co/cdxAFVimii

Happy birthday, @NAACP! #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/bYvXlpWuAr

"I greet you all in the name of peace, democracy and freedom for all."

May we honor him by refusing to tolerate hatred against Asian Americans in any form. https://t.co/63GyEEHB48

Providing poor mothers with cash stipends (read: the #ChildTaxCredit) for just 1 year of their children‚Äôs lives was so impactful it improved babies‚Äô brain function, according to this new & devastating study.

Thanks, Patrick‚Äî& happy anniversary to @PEPFAR! Since its founding, PEPFAR has transformed the global AIDS response with over 21 million lives saved. 

This work is critical both in the near term w/COVID & in reaching our goal of ending #HIV as a public health threat by 2030. https://t.co/zg1RrDFnGa

In its 20 years, @GlobalFund has saved 44 million lives.

I remember establishing a framework for the Global Fund back in 2000. Our work to grow it over the years has been incredibly rewarding. It‚Äôs clear that with continued commitment, we can reach an HIV/AIDS-free generation. https://t.co/jCOvyyK9IA

Today, on the 50th anniversary of her run, I‚Äôm announcing the start of the Chisholm Trail‚Äîa yearlong celebration and recognition of her legacy. I‚Äôll be traveling to places across the country that had a profound impact on her life.

See you on the #ChisholmTrail‚úåüèø!

As the first woman and first African American to run for president, she paved the way for countless women and POC in elected office today‚Äîmyself included. I feel so grateful to have had her as a mentor.

She was the first Black congresswoman, and now she was running for president. Her campaign meant so much to me. I threw myself into her run. Now THIS was a candidate who stood up against racism and sexism, who fought for children, families, and immigrants.

50 years ago, I was a young mom on public assistance & food stamps.

I was serving as president of the Black Student Union, volunteering w/the Black Panther Party, & raising 2 boys.

I wasn‚Äôt excited about any of the men running for president. And then I met Shirley Chisholm. https://t.co/y8TDNx3GPG

Today is another day that thousands of people of color sit in jail for marijuana offenses while others profit.

Congress must end the discriminatory laws upholding the unjust, classist, racist War on Drugs.

This country is long overdue for a racial healing commission and progress towards reparations. #HR40 #HConRes19
https://t.co/vrvxO4O0F6

Clean energy is the fastest growing industry in America. 

Jobs pay well above the national average & most don‚Äôt require a college degree.

Addressing the climate crisis is how we #BuildBackBetter. https://t.co/MobUK1Th8x

The decision to have an abortion must be made by the individual, not by politicians. The Senate must pass the #WomensHealthProtectionAct and protect abortion under federal law. #ActforAbortionAccess @ProChoiceCaucus

Abortion bans don‚Äôt stop abortions, they just make them harder and riskier to get. This is about life or death. It‚Äôs about racial, economic, and gender equality. It‚Äôs about reproductive freedom. https://t.co/fv8rZ4w7Nn

Many young people now don‚Äôt know a world without Roe v. Wade‚ÄîI do.

In the 1960s, unsafe abortions were a leading killer of African American women. If Roe is overturned, the consequences will be most sharply felt by those who already face barriers to reproductive health care.
Sending @ReginaKing and her family my love, prayers, and deepest sympathy upon the tragic death of her beloved son Ian. There are no words to convey this depth of a loss. May his soul rest in peace.

In recent years, we have lost lives, homes, and entire communities to historic wildfires in California. 

These resources will be a huge help in our battle to limit the damage from climate-driven fires. Thank you, @POTUS for responding to this threat with the urgency it deserves. https://t.co/hpxBruwM97

I don't know about you, but I don't want to find out what comes after #Omicron in the Greek alphabet.

To #EndThePandemic we must address global health inequities by delivering more vaccines, tests, & quality care. We've made progress under @POTUS, but there's more to get done.

My condolences go to the loved ones of Cheryl A. Hickmon, and to all of the members of Delta Sigma Theta Sorority Inc. She was truly a phenomenal woman who dedicated her life to service and sisterhood. May she rest in peace and power.

Last night‚Äôs vote was a major setback for democracy. 

History will not be kind to the Senators who chose the side of Jim Crow, of unequal representation, of dark money controlling our country.

But I refuse to lose hope. The fight for voting rights is far from being over.

Nixon. Ford. Reagan. George H.W. & George W. Bush.
 
These Republican presidents reauthorized the Voting Rights Act. 
 
The bill was reauthorized & amended w/bipartisan support 5x.
 
Where is the Republican support now?
 
#WeWantVotingRights

I will always value her wise counsel and support. Rest In Peace and Power, Lani.
